meanings.definition: A type of lizard known for its ability to change color to blend in with its surroundings.
meanings.sent1: Chameleons can change color to match the leaves they sit on.
meanings.sent2: I saw a chameleon on a tree, perfectly blending in with the bark.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon at the zoo made me laugh when it turned bright pink to match a flower.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was like a chameleon, shifting from happy to sad in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon's camouflage was so impressive, it seemed like magic.

meanings.definition: A person who is able to adapt or change their behavior to fit in with different social situations.
meanings.sent1: She was a social chameleon, effortlessly fitting in with any group she joined.
meanings.sent2: He was like a chameleon at work, adjusting his approach based on who he was talking to.
meanings.sent3: The party was full of chameleons, each one blending in with a different crowd.
meanings.sent4: In the meeting, his chameleon-like ability to adapt impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: Being a chameleon in social settings can be both advantageous and exhausting.
